summary.para: This method allows a compute-shader–based transform to select the number of thread groups to execute based on the number of output pixels it needs to fill.

param.name: outputRect
param.para: The output rectangle that will be filled by the compute transform.

param.name: dimensionX
param.para: The number of threads in the x dimension.

param.name: dimensionY
param.para: The number of threads in the y dimension.

param.name: dimensionZ
param.para: The number of threads in the z dimension.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If this call fails, the corresponding instance is placed into an error state and fails to draw.

summary.para: Sets the render information used to specify the compute shader pass.

param.name: computeInfo
param.para: The render information object to set.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Defines a transform that uses a compute shader.

remarks.para: The transform implements the normal Shatzis methods by implementing . In addition, the caller is passed an to describe the compute pass that the transform should execute.
